course_title: History of Latinx Biblical Interpretation: It's Aims and Scopes
class_notes:
(Open to HSP 2023 participants only; instructor Dr. Francisco Lozada
Brite Divinity School)
course_description: This course gives a broad overview of U.S. Latinx (os/as/es) biblical interpretation's aims & scope from its initial articulations in the latter 1/3 of the 20th century to the present day. It begins by examining the social, political, & theological events that gave rise to Latinx biblical interpretation & ends with how the questions Latinx scholars raise impact social, political, & theological questions. Key issues such as diaspora/exile, borderlands, colonialism, immigration, identity formations, "whiteness" and racialization in and outside Latinx experiences, & the experiences of assimilation & hybridity are among some of the social factors discussed in this course. Students will become familiar with the major themes of Latinx biblical interpretation, understand how Latinx scholars view the nature of texts, interpret texts, & use texts. At the end, students will be able place Latinx biblical interpretation in conversation with the broader field of biblical interpretation.
